content.description: Definitely a wild feature and some pretty unique exposure for a boulder but the lower rock in the traverse leaves something to be desired. Worth doing for sure.Â
content.location: Hard to miss the Spearpoint jutting out from the hillside on the approach from the disc golf course parking area down the access trail to the main Mossy Bluff Trail. ~2min

content.description: Stand start on the furthest rightside lip of the Spearpoint Boulder and traverse clockwise (Right to Left) to the farthest leftside of the Spearpoint and topout same as "Run Em Down".
content.location: On the Spearpoint Boulder. Furthest boulder up the creek bed roughly 100yds from the parking lot.

content.description: First boulder you see when walking down the trail from disc golf parking. Landing is very sketchy so make sure you have all the lip holds cleaned off and the topout prepped before you climb on this boulder.
